Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerated because it implies that Evan Jenkins consistently referred to his philosophy as "progressive mainstream" throughout his career, which may not be the case.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it only provides one instance in which Evan Jenkins used the phrase "progressive mainstream" in 2003. It does not provide additional evidence or examples to support the claim.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes the assumption that using the phrase "progressive mainstream" in 2003 automatically means that Evan Jenkins still holds that philosophy in the present. This assumption may not be accurate as political ideologies can change over time.
Exist alternative explanation: There could be alternative explanations for why Evan Jenkins used the phrase "progressive mainstream" in 2003. It is possible that he was referring to the political climate and aspirations of that specific time period, rather than indicating a long-term philosophy.
